The image is humorous and satirical because it highlights the irony of owning an ergonomic chair designed for comfort and proper posture, yet still sitting with a bad posture. 

On the left, the chair is empty and highlighted as exemplifying comfort and good design, indicated by the word "YES." On the right, the same chair is occupied by a person sitting with poor posture, despite the ergonomic benefits, indicated by the word "BUT."

The humor comes from the common experience of people investing in ergonomic solutions but not actually using them properly, thus defeating their purpose.
